intro: Oligochaeta divaricata, commonly known as the variable chaeta plant, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a finely divided, feathery appearance. Oligochaeta divaricata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
